intro: Kobresia dregeana, commonly known as the desert feathergrass, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and fine, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Kobresia dregeana is well adapted to harsh, dry environments, with deep root systems that help it survive in nutrient-poor soils. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small desert animals.
